dt: {bc}the quantity that can be carried at one time by a specified means
{bc}a measured quantity of a commodity fixed for each type of carrier
{bc}whatever is put on a person or pack animal to be carried {bc}{sx|pack||}
{bc}whatever is put in a ship or vehicle or airplane for conveyance {bc}{sx|cargo||}

dt.t: The ship was carrying a {wi}load{/wi} of automobiles.

dt: {bc}a quantity of material assembled or packed as a shipping unit
{bc}a mass or weight supported by something

dt.t: branches bent low by their {wi}load{/wi} of fruit

dt: {bc}the forces to which a structure is subjected due to superposed weight or to wind pressure on the vertical surfaces
{bc}the forces to which a given object is subjected

dt.t: Losing weight will lessen the {wi}load{/wi} on your knees.

dt: {bc}something that weighs down the mind or spirits

dt.t: always carried his share of the {wi}load{/wi}

dt: {bc}the quantity of material {a_link|loaded} into a device at one time
{bc}external resistance overcome by a machine or prime mover
{bc}power output (as of a power plant) or power consumption (as by a device)
{bc}a device to which power is delivered
{bc}the amount of work that a person carries or is expected to carry
{bc}the amount of authorized work to be performed by a machine, a group, a department, or a factory
{bc}the demand on the operating resources of a system (such as a telephone exchange or a refrigerating apparatus)
used in the phrase {it}get a load of{/it}

dt.t: Get a {wi}load{/wi} of his new car.

dt: {bc}the amount of a deleterious or pathogenic agent, growth, or substance present in a human or animal body or test sample (as of blood or tissue)

dt.t: Recent advances in our knowledge about how HIV replicates sprang from new technology able to measure {phrase}viral load{/phrase}—the level of HIV—in the blood. … The higher a person's {wi}viral load{/wi}, the faster he or she gets sick.
In patients with a heavy hepatic {phrase}tumor load{/phrase}, liver transplantation may prolong useful life.
Over time the {phrase}worm load{/phrase} will damage the heart, shortening the dog's life.

dt: {bc}an amount added (as to the price of a security or the net premium in insurance) to represent selling expense and profit to the distributor

et: Middle English {it}lod{/it}, from Old English {it}lād{/it} support, carrying {ma}{mat|lode|}{/ma}
shortdef: the quantity that can be carried at one time by a specified means; especially : a measured quantity of a commodity fixed for each type of carrier —often used in combination
whatever is put on a person or pack animal to be carried : pack
whatever is put in a ship or vehicle or airplane for conveyance : cargo; especially : a quantity of material assembled or packed as a shipping unit

dt: {bc}to put a load in or on
{bc}to place in or on a means of conveyance
{bc}to encumber or oppress with something heavy, laborious, or disheartening {bc}{sx|burden||}
{bc}to place as a burden or obligation
{bc}to increase the weight of by adding something heavy
{bc}to add a conditioning substance (such as a mineral salt) to for body
{bc}to weight or shape (dice) to fall unfairly
{bc}to pack with one-sided or prejudicial influences {bc}{sx|bias||}
{bc}to charge with multiple meanings (such as emotional associations or hidden implications)
{bc}to weight (something, such as a test) with factors influencing validity or outcome
{bc}to put runners on (first, second, and third bases) in baseball
{bc}to put a load or charge in (a device or piece of equipment)
{bc}to place or insert especially as a load in a device or piece of equipment
{bc}to copy or transfer (something, such as a program or data) into the memory of a digital device (such as a computer) especially from an external source (such as a disk drive or the Internet)

dt.t: {wi}Load{/wi} a new program or game onto your hard disk, and you must run an installation program that decompresses the information held on the floppy disks

dt: {bc}to put a supply of funds or resources into (an account, a gift card, etc.)

dt.t: She was told to go to the Dollar General Store and {wi}load{/wi} a Google Play gift card with $100.

dt: {bc}to alter (something, such as an alcoholic drink) by adding an adulterant or drug
{bc}to add a load to (an insurance premium)
{bc}to add a sum to after profits and expenses are accounted for
{bc}to put a load on or in a carrier, device, or container
{bc}to insert the charge or cartridge in the chamber of a firearm
{bc}to go or go in as a load

dt.t: senators {it}loading up on{/it} fried chicken and champagne

shortdef: to put a load in or on
to place in or on a means of conveyance
to encumber or oppress with something heavy, laborious, or disheartening : burden

dt: {bc}the percentage of available seats paid for and occupied in an aircraft

shortdef: the percentage of available seats paid for and occupied in an aircraft

dt: {bc}the line on a ship indicating the depth to which it sinks in the water when properly loaded {dx}see {dxt|plimsoll mark|plimsoll mark|illustration}{/dx}

shortdef: the line on a ship indicating the depth to which it sinks in the water when properly loaded

dt: {bc}to burden or oppress with something heavy, laborious, or disheartening

dt.t: The company is {it}loaded down with{/it} debt.

shortdef: to burden or oppress with something heavy, laborious, or disheartening

dt: {bc}the amount of laundry that is placed into a washing machine

dt.t: I need to do a {it}load of laundry{/it}.

shortdef: the amount of laundry that is placed into a washing machine

dt: {bc}to unfairly make one possible result more likely than another

dt.t: We received information that would {it}load the dice{/it} in favor of our arguments.
The {it}dice were loaded{/it} against them but they still managed to win.

shortdef: to unfairly make one possible result more likely than another

dt: {bc}to consume a large amount of carbohydrates through food intake usually in order to improve performance in an upcoming athletic event (such as a marathon)

shortdef: to consume a large amount of carbohydrates through food intake usually in order to improve performance in an upcoming athletic event (such as a marathon)

dt: {bc}a constant load in a structure (such as a bridge, building, or machine) that is due to the weight of the members, the supported structure, and permanent attachments or accessories

shortdef: a constant load in a structure (such as a bridge, building, or machine) that is due to the weight of the members, the supported structure, and permanent attachments or accessories

dt: {bc}the part of the total commission and expenses taken out of early payments under a contract plan for the periodic purchase of investment-company shares
